jeK42VAUeLHapVrocVmPAg.text: By far the best sushi joints in the southeast, where quality Asian eateries are few and far between, and easily one of the best in town.   Sushi (and sashimi) menu is fairly comprehensive, complemented by Daily Catch and Omakase (i.e, A Japanese version of prix fixe). On my first visit, I ordered the Chirashi Lunch Special ($15.95), with a side of Toro and Scallion Roll ($10). The hot tea was free (I think).   The lunch special came with miso soup, salad, and chirashi bowl. The fish was very fresh and in generous potion, and the sushi rice was very flavorful. I highly recommend it to all who like poke bowls - in comparison to most places specializing in poke bowls, here you are getting high-quality fish of different varieties, proper sushi rice, restaurant-quality soup & salad, and unlimited supply of green tea (that doesn't come from a tea bag). In addition, the lunch potion was so generous that, half way through it, I started to regret the side-dish order.   The place is clean and bright. Service was friendly and attentive. While I was there, a shipment of 27lbs of tuna came in, and I took a photo of Hiro San going at it - perhaps for the dinner service? In any case, I'll definite be back for the Omakase menu.

rKNe7vK1JTHQ-BMJHSbBsw.text: I am definitely not a big fan of this place. I have came here multiple times hoping that it would get better and it never does. Their sashimi is not something I would ever recommend getting here. The most recent trip here the tuna looked to be very old; it was discolored with a greenish tint and a bit fishier than normal. They are also a bit overpriced for the quality of food that they have. The food not pertaining to fish was decent though. Lunch time would be the best time to go.

XKlEYaWEt7ZaKwitwiOTUw.text: Sushi Hiro is such a hot spot these days. There is always a line for a table especially around lunch time.   Lunch and dinner specials are really what make this sushi joint great. For a decent price the lunch and dinner specials come with a huge portion. The sushi and sashimi specials come with miso soup and salad. They have a chef selection of fishes and all are good quality. The bento specials come with an entree of your choice, miso soup, salad, selected tempura, and a california roll. So much food!  If you do not want to eat the lunch or dinner specials, you can order al la carte. However, I don't recommend doing this. Whatever fish I ordered in nigiri and sashimi was not the fish they brought out to me. They claim to have all these rare fishes, but when I order them, they always bring me "similar" fishes and not the exact one I order. Just beware of this so you don't get ripped off.  Update: The yellowtail cappacio is really good! Take note that they put a lot of the oil sauce so I would ask for light sauce.

Ku6kjoLGLjhX7dYu3m7ugA.text: This is hands down my favorite sushi restaurant in Las Vegas. It's a local spot with local pricing. The fish is as fresh as the top sushi restaurants on the Strip. Sushi Hiro gets fresh fish from Tokyo a couple times a week just like those fancier places. The chirashi is a fantastic mix of fresh fish on a large box of rice. My husband refers to it as the "box of fish." Also try the homemade tofu if it's available. It's a firm type of tofu but the mix of toppings is delightful.  My favorite though, is the chef's tasting menu. Go big! This is an amazing experience. It's 8 courses of delicious raw and cooked foods. Service is great when you're sitting at the sushi bar so I recommend doing that whenever possible. I've never needed a reservation but I usually go on a weekday later in the evening or on a Sunday for lunch.  Check it out. You won't be disappointed.

Ux5wmhk3JbJDcu3ooU2o9A.text: First time eating here and I was pleasantly surprised, the atmosphere is clean and friendly staff with prompt service.  The sushi is super fresh and yummy !  I love it !!

photos.caption: Photo of Sushi Hiro - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Fresh fish menu rocks

Du0fH8GiZG8vemV3I2A-hg.text: I enjoyed Sushi Hiro very much. There is such a plethora of Sushi places in town and that is such a great thing for us Las Vegans.  There are very traditional places, the popular Roll type of sushi houses and in this case with Sushi Hiro, a blend of your Roll type sushi house meets tradition.  1. The authenticity - I really love it when you can walk into a Sushi Restaurant and the Japanese that is spoken is more than just Irrashaimasu.  To hear the sushi chefs speaking the lingo and calling out orders for pick up in that traditional way just adds to the ambiance.  2.  The ambiance - I like the simple originality of the place. Big Sushi bar, a few tables in the middle, and then booths with a bit of privacy along the side.  Clean, efficient lighting and those large wrapped Sake Barrels used as part of the decor.  Lighting is just right, the lights themselves are so simple and nice.  Just a great place to enter.  Not much room for waiting though.  3. Service - The team tonight was tapped out as it was freaking busy at 8:00 pm on a Friday night.  The wifey and I entered when there was a small lull, but about 8:45 pm the second or third wave hit and it was swamped. But alas, the team is so friendly, nice and welcoming.  4.  The Food - That is what we are here to talk about so let's rock this place out.  a. The rolls - As you may be aware by now, I am not a huge roll fan, however, I find them definitely edible and tasty. I mean, as a comparison,  I find grilled cheese and PBJ sandwiches tasty and edible, just don't order it much.  Back to Sushi, the rolls here are very good. Rather than the huge massive rolls that are packed and heavy, these rolls are rather delicate. each piece is cut thin and each piece is about 75% the size of those normal rolls you get elsewhere. I do like this in many ways because the taste is simpler, more defined and it seems the nature of the fish and rice stands out more.  When I go to an AYCE Sushi place, I can eat the rolls, but i find that all the flavors and the tastes are masked due to all the sauces and ingredients mixed in.  Here the essence of the sushi is more refined.  If you are a big roll eater and like that huge mix of ingredients, you will find perhaps some disappointment, so be aware that this is entirely a different style of sushi rolls.  b. The Goodies -   Ankimo - ordered up an order of Ankimo, monkfish liver.  You don't get to find this everywhere. It was great and with a bit of scallion, daikon and ponzu sauce to round it out. I am not sure why I like monkfish.  Don't google a picture of one.  I don't know who goes around the world saying "look at that fish"  isn't that one tasty fellow!  When I got my first look at a monkfish, I think it was a bit frightening.  Mirugai - You cannot imagine how many sushi places I go to and attempt to get this Geoduck clam or any other type of clam and it is not easy to get. I get a no more than a yes. Here they had it as a special and i ordered it sashimi style. Again, simple, great texture, fresh.  One of my favorites and they had it.  Loved that they served it very simply in a plate with some Wakame.  A nice pairing.  By the way, if you ever googled a picture of this clam, you would probably never order it, so don't google it...and keep your kids away from it.  O-Toro- When ever I am ordering sashimi and tuna specifically, I generally am getting the Maguro. Love Maguro and you get a lot of it in an order as well.  Here they had as a special O-toro. That fatty belly part of the tuna is so tasty and melts in your mouth. I often don't get it at many places, but ask and here it was one of the specials. I enjoyed it and that made it a bit special tonight.  Escolar Super White Tuna - Whenever I go to a place and they have superwhite, I have no idea if it is albacore tuna or escolar fish.  Here they tell you straight up it is escolar.  That fatty special controversial fish that many consider a delicacy.  I guess some people's stomach does not go well with the fatty content that makes this fish so nice.  I had it as a sashimi as well at enjoyed it.  I won't order this all the time, but I do like to order it when I am feeling a wee bit adventurous.  Scooby Doo Roll and the Fashion Roll - Hey, come on, you knew I was going to get a roll anyway!  I had a few bites of these rolls and like I said above, nice, simple, delicate.  Dessert - If you check in on yelp, right now they are offering a free dessert. Mochi ice cream and it tastes great. Always like that.  I will be coming back here for sure to try more of what they offer.  I stuck mainly to the specials and sashimi tonight to get the best possible taste of their fish offerings.  For the second time here, I enjoyed it and will be coming back for sure!

r4I8SMRPNvnyFh3tTNui6A.text: I've only been here once, and I usually visit restaurants at least a couple times before giving them the big 5* - but I'm pretty certain Sushi Hiro will hold up. The reason is that the fish quality is very high, the availability of traditional Japanese fish is good (e.g. on my visit, mirugai, kinmedai, and yari ika were all on the specials list), and it seems like Chef Hiro knows what he's doing.  I see this place as somewhere I see myself splurging a ton ordering a la carte just because the quality is so high, which is great b/c there's nowhere I feel compelled to do that on this side of town. Really the only other places in Vegas I do that right now are the two edomae spots in Chinatown, which are only open for dinner and usually need reservations. Hiro offers a more casual, anytime option, and that's great for people on the Henderson side of things.  I look forward to repeat visits, including trying some of the hot food as well as the omakase menu, and updating my review accordingly.

gd0HuA9rIDUbhMWjJMOGzQ.text: This has to be the best sushi in town! It's my go-to sushi spot every time. The staff and the sushi chefs are so friendly and provide great service. The atmosphere is quaint and appealing. My boyfriend and I always head to the sushi bar and really enjoy the company of the sushi chef/ owner of the restaurant.  The sushi is very fresh and DELICIOUS! I love the fact that the sushi rolls do not have a thick layer of rice, as that gets a little too much sometimes. My favorite sushi roll has to be the Shrimp Tempura roll, I get it every time. The sashimi dinners are amazing as well, how fresh the fish is and the presentation as well. Whether you're going for a date night or a casual dinner/ lunch, this is an excellent spot for some incredible sushi and friendly staff.

7DHcLWB5oOUyx9E22qp6ag.text: Fresh fish.  Melts in your mouth.  Good prices especially for lunch

BbF3cjlFNu0vLg3A5g9Tew.text: Sushi Hero has many 5 star reviews so expectations were high, unfortunately we were totally underwhelmed. Everyones tastes are different but Yelp is about honest reviews and that is what I will write. We arrived around 5:30 and were quickly greeted and seated in a booth.   I started off with an ice cold Kirin draft while looking at the menu. There are no complimentary appetizers or salads like many other sushi or japanese restaurants (edamame, green salad with ginger dressing, cucumber salad, etc). We put an order in for a few different rolls and nigiri sushi.   All of the order with the exception of the crazy tuna roll was served in the boat which was a really cool presentation. We first tried the yellowtail sushi was fine, pretty thin cut but average. We then went to the eel roll and both looked at each other as we ate it. The eel was very fishy tasting which fish should never be. The rice was cold and hard (like if you have ever had sushi from a supermarket). We did not finish the roll.   We then tried the philly roll, spicy tuna and crazy tuna rolls and again did not care for them at all. The spicy tuna was very "dry" and again all of the rice was hard instead of warm and soft.  In all fairness this is more of a traditional sushi restaurant so maybe it just wasn't our taste. Maybe it was an off night? Im not sure but its definitely not like us to not finish our sushi.   Our waitress noticed we didn't finish our food and asked why we didn't like it. We explained the eel was very fishy and she told us they switched to a new supplier and that might have been the issue. She was kind enough to take the eel roll off the bill. Everyone was very friendly and service was good but I cannot give more than 2 stars due to the sushi.

LN3xXN_6pj6ooXCAR04zQA.text: I have to admit not a big fan of anything other then AYCE sushi. Sushi HIro never missed beat without the AYCE. Sometimes in sushi life not about quantity but quality. Although I only ordered one sushi roll (Crunchy Toro Special) from the daily special rolls. It was really really good. The fish quality was fresh and like the combination they came up with for the Crunchy Toro Roll). Not sure if maybe there thing or no doubt found the size of any of the speciality rolls HUGE. Basically your getting two or three extra pieces then regular sushi restaurant if ordered speciality roll. So warning if going specialty rolls two or three that LOT of food. The diversity of the speciality rolls is awesome. They literally have pictures of believe all the specialty rolls on the menu. Really not often seen full menu that literally every dish has picture with it.   My entree ordered from the Dinner Bento Box and got the teriyaki chicken. They have few other protein options if going with the Bento Box. The thing that stood out for me. Most traditional Japanese restaurants that has the Bento or Box dinner on the menu. Not that big. The size at Sushi Hiro is pretty big. Literally every box is filled with food. It also come with miso soup and house salad. Both very tasty. The house salad nice fresh greens and the kicker was the salad dressing was awesome. I would buy bottle of that if they sold it. The teriyaki chicken was just ok. It could have been marinated longer or lacked distinct teriyaki flavor for me.  The service was five star. I came for dinner help celebrate another yelper Terri R birthday with other friends of hers. It was no big deal getting separate checks for party of seven. They were friendly, attentive, and nothing but five star service in my mind.   The restaurant is small but love the interior decor. It very much your traditional style Japanese Restaurant.   Not often on that side of town. Sushi Hiro is sushi spot that would hit up again!!!!

Z6EFH8uZ9jPI2nXafFWJtQ.text: I loved this place right away and just knew it was a five star sushi spot.   As soon as we walked in we were warmly greeted. The hostess offered sushi bar seating or a booth. We opted for a booth which has nice shades on each side for some privacy. Our hostess ended up being our waitress and she started us off with warm towels. The first thing that struck my attention was how clean the restaurant appeared.   I started with the House Salad and the cold ginger dressing didn't disappoint. My husband and I shared the Shumai appetizer which was tender and delicious. We weren't overly hungry so we stuck to sharing two rolls, the Funky Roll and the Fire Dragon Roll. Both tasted fresh and had great flavor. The rolls were nice portions. I wrapped up with the Yelp check-in offer for a free dessert. The Tempura Green Tea Ice Cream was so delicious. I loved the crisp of the tempura coating and the creamy green tea ice cream.  Our waitress provided amazing service during our visit. She was friendly and attentive. Our food came out quickly. Overall, we were delighted with our experience here. This is one of those restaurants that I wish I could give six stars.

vs3hUxvr1kq-lF1rzrwZWA.text: 3.5 star is more like it.  Service - Spectacular Food - Hubby and I each got the Sashimi dinner and while the pieces are thick and nicely sized, the quality wasn't the best.  The tuna sashimi was my least favorite and the bowl of rice (side order) was not the sushi rice that I was accustomed to. Dessert - Green Tea Tempura ice cream was what we each selected since we got a free dessert upon check-in via Yelp App offer.  It was beautifully presented, with the waiter lighting the tempura icecream on fire, hence the tempura was nice, warm, and crispy.  I have had green tempura ice cream at many other restaurants, but Sushi Hiro's version is hands down, the best version.

0dC9nC3WudwTTTZJJn66LA.text: Located off of Eastern Ave. in the massive shopping plaza with restaurants like Cafe Zupas and Taco y Taco, Sushi Hiro is a welcome addition to the dining scene. Folks in Henderson don't have to drive to the Strip or China Town for excellent Japanese. This modest and modern spot has a long sushi counter. It's the best spot to dine if you want to watch the chefs in action. The omakase (two different options) is reasonably priced at $49 and $69, a bargain for the quality and amount of food you get.   Halibut sashimi in tofu oil and yuzu began the meal, with an oyster shooter next. A large portion of shrimp and vegetable tempura followed, all lightly coated and exceptionally crispy.  Fish is where they excel. Tuna from Spain, yellowtail, and ocean trout were all sizable cuts of  quality fish. Another large dish followed with the salmon kama deep fried and sitting in a rich and aromatic agedashi broth. The sushi course was also excellent, particularly the tuna and red snapper. All came glazed with house made sauces.  Ending the meal was a rich and dense green tea cheesecake -- creamy like a traditional American style cheesecake instead of a lighter and fluffier Japanese cheesecake.  4.5 Stars

kSPkluLaCK36fOWwterQjw.text: It was my first time eating sushi in Las Vegas, and this restaurant did not disappoint. The staff were Japanese, and as expected, they were awesome. The hospitality was amazing. The food, more so! We got the sashimi and other couple of rolls, and they were delicious! I loved my experience here and would totally come back.

-q03GYSy6KMpYOaCrxcQ3g.text: Sushi Hiro has become our favorite restaurant and it is in our regular rotation for date night. This place works out for everyone because it has all the rolls you can imagine, but we don't come here for that.  (But if that's your thing, you'll be more than happy here!)    Our focus is the sashimi dinner, the dinner chirashi, and whatever daily fish they have in stock.  With fresh deliveries coming in twice a week, I love looking out for their most unique items and our favorite is getting the whole Aji Tsukuri.  They recently had this Uni Tray that came with toro, salmon eggs, seaweed, and rice and you put the whole thing together yourself.  So good!  I am happy to bypass all the AYCE sushi joints in town to get some quality fish here.  I really can't say enough about Chef Hiro and his team. I love coming here and they know it. They've been open for a little over a year now and are going strong.  It's super busy on weekends, so make reservations! Families are welcome and large parties are often present.  If you see me there, don't be shy to say hi!

_mECcPem8vvN2ogvrx0_8w.text: Two Words: Up-And-Coming Restaurant  Chef Hiro and his brother are two of the most friendly people I have met in Vegas. From the moment you enter and the moment you leave, you are met with warm smiles and leave feeling quite satisfied. It is a fact that they know how to run a successful business as high-quality food and superior service is their standard.  Sit at the sushi bar to ogle the fresh fish where friendly conversation is well-received and returned.  Brian, Stella and the hostess are very knowledgeable of the menu and attentive to all guests.   Appetizer: Fresh Salmon Spring Roll - This is light and refreshing. Salmon sashimi, shrimp, green salad, shiso leave, kaiware radish wrapped with rice paper. This is served with sweet sesame dipping sauce.  Roll:  Plum Tree - Tuna, salmon, and yellowtail wrapped in rice and topped with red, wasabi green and orange fish roe. The presentation was marvelous - I almost did not want to eat it because it was too beautiful! The flavors were rich and the crunchy texture of the roe paired well with the soft and creamy texture of the fresh salmon.  Dessert: Strawberry and Red Bean Ice Cream: Another beautiful presentation of lightly drizzled chocolate with mochi ice cream from the popular desert spot, Mikawaya (Los Angeles).  Chef Hiro and his brother recommended I try the Omakase ($45-65) - this seems to be the item of highest value as other high-end restaurants charge at least double of the price.   If you are in the area and would like to be served high-quality fresh foods with top-notch service, stop by Hiro Sushi!

7zwwjLjDQejvNq46Mx6ZPQ.text: Very welcoming and clean, excellent and very fast service! All of the sushi was very fresh. I love that unlike a lot of sushi places this felt like it could be a really nice sit down place for a more romantic evening. I will for sure be back!

9jPBVHoP0ZfA7G_8ddVEyg.text: Excellent service. Good food. Nice space.  My date and I decided on one roll and one small plate each - and we'd share everything.  We started with Yellowtail Carpaccio which was quite good and a very reasonable serving size. This would make a good main course for a lighter appetite.  Our two rolls were "Mermaid Roll" and "Plum Roll" (which, we were told, was the chef's specialty). Both were good, and were *huge*.   We split an order of uni (sea urchin) which he liked more than I.  All in all - this was a *Lot* of food. Almost too much for two big guys. I would prefer smaller rolls - and then I'd get several, rather than one large roll each.  (Maybe they'll add a half-roll option?)  The total came out to what you would pay at any AYCE place, but the food quality was definitely a step up from that.   Not blown away, but very good and certainly more than satisfactory.   I would return for the lovely environment and excellent service.

VjnuGIjryVYMh7uBFvOJxQ.text: Very disappointed went here on my lunch break due to the reviews on yelp. This place was way over priced and I have eaten sushi many diffrent places. Price is not a issue when it come to great service and food. I eat eel ever time I eat sushi and NEVER have had bones in it.. when I called the chef and he said it was normal that all eel does well now I know they serve bones in eel here.. snMVqvIZCqoaIR9hmoY0cQ.text: The sushi is AMAZING. It's fresh, good selection, and a great atmosphere. Serving sizes are excellent. All of that is irrelevant after the customer service me and my wife just received.  The credit/debit machine was down. We were given two options: 1) drive a mile down the road to an ATM to get cash for the bill, or 2) they would WRITE DOWN my card info (number, expiration, and security code) and manually run it after the server came back up. Obviously, I went to the ATM, paid the additional fee, and 20 minutes later was back with my wife (who I had to leave at the restaurant so we didn't skip on the check) to pay the bill. No discount offered. The ENTIRE meal should have been free. It is not my fault your equipment is malfunctioning. To ask a customer to leave their credit card info written down!? Get out of here.

8tiLyIi8KVEeFVnFGlfxow.text: Went in for lunch today. I got a chirashi bowl and my bf got a bento box. Everything from decor,atmosphere,service and food was amazing. We sat in the booth and it had a little curtain for a little privacy which I loved. The quality of fish is amazing! I think they have the best sushi in town. Will come back for sure and I guess this sushi joint will be my goto spot. :)

Fxbl1hqlAKAeCoPih8PgPg.text: I have never had such wonderful service!If you are re-thinking coming here, stop thinking that.The baked salmon is so delicious, my best friends is also delicious.

qoqzd35BHaQVw_m1hvfHcw.text: Saw that this place was hot and new on Yelp so I came with my friend during her lunch break. There are a lot of other shops around it so it might be hard to find, but it's right next to taco y taco with a large grand opening sign hanging in front. As soon as we walked in, literally everyone greeted us which was surprising. We sat down in a little booth that also had black curtains which came down half way to give a little privacy. I ordered the lunch special bento box with salmon teriyaki and chose the California roll for my side and a iced green tea.  I was first served a little side salad and a cup of miso soup. The salad was pretty basic but the dressing was really interesting, I have no idea what it was but I liked it.  Then my bento box came out and everything was mouthwatering! The salmon had the perfect amount of glaze and wasn't dry at all - like other places I've tried. The pork gyoza that comes with it was awesome also, too bad it's only 2 pieces :(. I wasn't a big fan of the egg roll as it was a bit mushy like baby food. Our servers were very attentive, my drink was always full, and we were always checked up on.  Also, check in on Yelp to get a free dessert! I got the green tea mochi and was expecting just one mochi cut in half (like most sushi places) but I actually got 2 on a plate decorated with chocolate and whipped cream.   I would definitely come back!

ljrUdKeBcHChd6BPGoXv8Q.text: Came here with high expectations and was severely disappointed. While the people were extremely friendly and the restaurant was clean and had a great atmosphere, the food was sorely lacking in taste and quality. The rice in particular was terrible; not sure if it was a lack of water or over-cooking. The sushi was off as well, with the tuna being somewhat dry as if it had been out for a while, while the eel tasted overcooked. The avocado was not quite ripe; it affected the taste and texture. Definitely not going back.

AGMM4ftGfISps52PEcY3tw.text: Real Japanese chef and staff. Fish is fresh and delicious, especially the salmon (fatty and high quality), service is excellent, they re-filled the tea four times with no extra charge, portions are substantial, people are friendly, and the place is clean and pleasant, with traditional Japanese elements. Amazing price-value ratio.

Tuy6kAwRwT0pcOoSOK4PuQ.text: Best japanese restaurant ever!!! I would definitely recommend you guys!!! My husband is a half japanese and he is very amazed with the food, service and everything!!! We've been looking and trying different japanese restaurant here in Las Vegas, and finally we have found the most authentic japanese cuisine here in town :) Good thing, this place is just 1 mile away from our house. Will keep on coming back!!

IfZic6D2NH9R0HvKxYch3Q.text: Cute curtained booths, warm towels, clean restaurant, friendly staff. Ordered the following:  Karaage, Korokke, Beef Negimaki, Chicken Katsu Curry and Shrimp Tempura Sushi Roll Loved:  Beef Negimaki, Shrimp Tempura Sushi Roll Liked:  Chicken Katsu Curry Pass:  Karaage, Korokke Total came to $48 + tip. The price was a little high in ratio to satisfaction.  The Karaage were tiny pieces and tasted way overseasoned.  The Korokke was a little disappointing since the picture looked like 4 whole pieces, but when it arrived, it was actually 2 whole pieces cut into halves, so 4 halves...price seems high for 2 whole pieces, 4 would be more pleasing, even 3 more acceptable, but 2!? The Chicken Katsu Curry was plentiful and yummy and the shrimp tempura sushi roll was exactly as expected. The winner of the evening was the Beef Negimaki - I could eat this dish alone, just give me a bowl of rice to go with it and I'd be a happy camper. Great place to go for Japanese food if you are in the Henderson area.

yqvGfSjHU4z4egPuC26EQg.text: Very good . Great customer service . Even catered to altered menu items lol. Definitely has nice selection . My new spot for sushi and calamari for sure
